image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The number of people in custody has surged dramatically in the Northern Territory since the government passed sweeping bail and justice reforms in 2024.

title.children: UN blocked from inspecting crammed NT prisons

image.altText: A corridor of empty prison cells.

props.synopsis: Senior corrections and health staff will change how they respond to health emergencies inside NT jails, following the coronial inquest into the death of a disabled prisoner.

title.children: Corrections, health staff commit to change after grandfather's death in prison

image.altText: An aerial view of a fracking exploration site in the Beetaloo Basin.

props.synopsis: The gas-rich Beetaloo Basin in the Northern Territory has been in development for years — now, the NT government says the gas will finally flow from 2026.

title.children: Fracked gas to enter NT energy market by 2026 to 'keep the lights on'

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: A coroner's report has found there were multiple missed opportunities to improve or replace the public housing septic system, which the NT government had responsibility for.

title.children: Toddler's septic tank death 'likely would have been prevented' with maintenance

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: The announcement from NT police follows a months-long ABC investigation into the disappearance of a Yolŋu clan leader who vanished without a trace after being acquitted of murdering a police officer.

title.children: Police restart cold case investigation 90 years after clan leader's disappearance

image.altText: A man dressed in a Santa suit sits on a chair and is swamped by a mob of children.

props.synopsis: Santa Claus had a busy weekend in Alice Springs, with three community events celebrating the festive season.

title.children: Outback town pulls out all stops to celebrate Christmas and community

image.altText: A teacher holds her finger to her lips to hush the children sitting before her on the ground. Two young women sit on the ground.

props.synopsis: A course offered for the first time this year has upskilled home tutors working on remote central Australian cattle stations in a bid to ease education workforce shortages in the outback.

title.children: Plan to keep home tutors at remote NT stations passes the test

image.altText: Woman with head in hands with tax return on screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Perpetrators of financial abuse commit fraud by impersonating their partners, making them company directors in secret and putting business and tax debts in their names. The government wants to fix the problem, but will its proposed reforms go far enough?

title.children: 'How am I going to clear my name?' Debt swamps victims of secret fraud

image.altText: A silhouette of a man and a woman arguing

props.synopsis: Financial and domestic abuse survivors say the way Centrelink assesses benefit payments for people in a relationship makes it harder for women to leave dangerous relationships.

title.children: Abuse survivors say Centrelink's 'couple rule' puts women in danger

image.altText: A man stands in front of a blackened ground in a t-shirt, with a serious look on his face.

props.synopsis: A planned power outage went ahead in the Bulahdelah area in northern NSW on Friday despite an active bushfire in the region, which later destroyed four homes.

title.children: Planned power outage impacted ability to defend homes from bushfires

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Anika Wells press conference

props.synopsis: Family reunion travel is under scrutiny as new analysis shows federal MPs and senators spent $1.1 million on flying and driving their loved ones to Canberra and around Australia in 12 months.

title.children: We analysed MPs' spending on family reunions – here's what we found

image.altText: Donald Trump sits down for an interview.

props.synopsis: The US president has hinted he could walk away from supporting Ukraine and suggested it could cede territory to Moscow, as "Russia has the upper hand".

title.children: Trump criticises 'decaying' Europe and says 'size will win' in Ukraine

image.altText: Long rows of machines stretching into the distance at a Microsoft data center

props.synopsis: Australia has more than 250 data centres and more in the pipeline, prompting experts to warn against using drinking water to cool servers.

title.children: What we know about water use of the over 250 data centres in Australia

image.altText: A photo of a child with their face digitally blurred to obscure their identity.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the boy's death in state care hears he was a bright and mischievous boy who was proud of his heritage. WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: Family pays emotional tribute to 10yo boy as inquest closes

image.altText: A group of kids and adults dressed in Christmas costume surround a cow also dressed in Christmas.

props.synopsis: This 10-year-old is selling her family's cows to help raise funds for those who rescued her when she suffered a potentially deadly snake bite.

title.children: Child who survived deadly snake bite sells cows to raise money for helicopter

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: The judge granted the Justice Department's request under a new law requiring the release of files related to Jeffery Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title.children: US judge clears release of grand jury documents against Ghislaine Maxwell

image.altText: NSW Victoria border

props.synopsis: Which state has the longest land border? Test your knowledge in today's quiz.

title.children: Quiz: Test your knowledge of Australian geography

image.altText: A photo of a Bluey-themed sensory activity set in a box.

props.synopsis: The three "sensory activity sets" from HL Toys International include sealed tubs of coloured sand which Kmart said may contain the toxic mineral.

title.children: Popular Bluey, Paw Patrol toy sets recalled over asbestos fears

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: The latest target of Elon Musk's ire is the European Union, which he has called a "bureaucratic monster" that "should be abolished". So, what's going on?

title.children: Why is Elon Musk in a war of words with the European Union?

image.altText: A hand presses against a blue flak jacket with a "PRESS" label on it.

props.synopsis: Gaza has been named the deadliest place in the world to work as a journalist by French-based press freedom advocates Reporters Without Borders.

title.children: Gaza named deadliest place for journalists in 2025

image.altText: The scull of a dinosaur, positioned under spotlights.

props.synopsis: An ultra-rare dinosaur skeleton is being auctioned in London this week, sparking debate about the ethics of selling specimens with scientific value.

title.children: Dinosaur 'like nothing seen before' for sale and some scientists are angry

image.altText: Two police officers handcuff a man without a shirt.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old is expected to front court on Wednesday after been charged over the alleged shooting at a Tallawong home.

title.children: Man charged over alleged gunfire, grenade attack in Sydney's north-west

image.altText: rainy weather in sydney

props.synopsis: The most widespread rain in three months will develop across New South Wales during the coming days, reducing the threat of bushfires in the lead-up to Christmas.

title.children: NSW to cop most widespread rain in months over coming days

image.altText: A man with scruffy hair and beard posses with a Fellowship of the Ring movie poster.

props.synopsis: Peter Jackson's life wouldn't be the same after that red carpet event on December 10, 2001, but it's fair to say cinema, and New Zealand, wouldn't be the same either.

title.children: How Peter Jackson fought for his Middle Earth dream, armed with a VHS tape

image.altText: A man looking concerned, wearing a black mask, white shirt and orange blazer.

props.synopsis: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

title.children: Australian man accused of smuggling cocaine tells Bali court he was 'coerced'

image.altText: Anika Wells press conference

props.synopsis: The sports minister maintains all her taxpayer-funded expenses have been within the guidelines.

title.children: Wells initiates audit of expenses as Shorten defends her against 'pile-on'

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian market is likely to open slightly higher, following a cautious and relatively flat performance on Wall Street as the US Federal Reserve decides on whether to cut interest rates. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to rise as US Federal Reserve holds two-day meeting, likely to result in rate cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Borrowers bracing for higher mortgage repayments in 2026
Penalties push for financial abusers who draw partners into tax and company fraud
RBA governor's interest rates comments 'hawkish', says AMP economist

image.altText: Trump opens his hands as he talks at a table

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has expressed frustration over his judicial nominations getting blocked as the lawyer he hand-picked as New Jersey's top federal prosecutor, Alina Habba, quits.

title.children: Trump laments he 'can't appoint anybody' as prosecutor quits unlawful tenure

image.altText: A group of men sit on the back of a truck at night, some holding guns

props.synopsis: More than 140,000 civilians have been evacuated from border regions since fresh fighting between Thailand and Cambodia began on Sunday, officials said.

title.children: Thousands forced to flee as Thailand-Cambodia border clashes spread

image.altText: Several firefighters evacuate a victim from the site of a fire as other crews look on

props.synopsis: The fire broke out on the first floor of an office building in Indonesia's capital around midday on Tuesday, with at least 100 firefighters deployed to contain the blaze.

title.children: At least 22 killed as fire rips through office block in Jakarta

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country is ready to move forward with a US-backed peace proposal.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's initial proposal to end the war was judged by Ukraine's allies to be overly favourable to Russia.

title.children: Ukraine to send US revised peace plan as Zelenskyy rules out ceding territory

image.altText: A crowd of hundreds of people gathered outside a lit-up stadium

props.synopsis: Suncorp Stadium says "technical issues" identified during a sound check meant the gates did not open until 50 minutes later than scheduled, which caused long queues.

title.children: Fans face mayhem trying to get into Brisbane Lady Gaga concert

image.altText: Aiden Markram walks off after being bowled

props.synopsis: The rematch of last year's T20 World Cup final is dominated by India as South Africa is dismissed for just 74 runs.

title.children: Proteas crash to record low as India flexes muscles ahead of World Cup

image.altText: Helmut Marko and Max Verstappen smiling together.

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen reacts as Helmut Marko's retirement leaves Red Bull without its two main guiding personalities since its entry into F1.

title.children: 'Forever grateful' Verstappen pays tribute to retiring Red Bull icon

image.altText: Chloe Ainsworth celebrates after dismissing Meg Lanning

props.synopsis: The Perth Scorchers keep their WBBL title hopes alive with a win over the Stars in a knockout final, as youngster Chloe Ainsworth shows her credentials on the big stage.

title.children: Scorchers take aim at Sixers as young gun outduels Lanning in WBBL
